assumptions: Curriculum coordinators control textbook selection and adoption decisions
Schools are actively transitioning from print to digital curriculum materials
Budget allocation exists for instructional material digitization

current_solutions.description: Enterprise-focused AI video creation tools with avatar instructors
Traditional screen recording and video editing software for educators
Service-based approaches combining AI and human expertise

issues: Priced for corporate training budgets, not K-12 school districts
Lack educational formatting specificity and curriculum standards alignment
Require significant manual post-processing for educational accuracy
failure_modes.evidence: School districts report AI platforms cost $50-200/seat/month, exceeding typical curriculum budgets

issues: Inconsistent quality across different content creators
Limited scalability for district-wide textbook conversion
failure_modes.evidence: Curriculum coordinators cite 10-40 hours per chapter for manual video creation

issues: Partial content conversion creating fragmented learning experiences
High per-project costs limiting adoption to pilot programs only
Dependency on external vendors for updates and revisions
failure_modes.evidence: Service costs range from $5,000-50,000 per textbook with 8-12 week turnaround times

icp_attributes.company_type: Public school district or private school network
core_responsibilities: Digital learning resource procurement and evaluation
current_workflows: Coordinating digital content adoption across schools
Managing curriculum alignment with state standards
Facilitating teacher training on new instructional materials
trigger_events: State funding allocations for instructional materials
District mandates for digital curriculum transformation
Student engagement and learning outcome improvement initiatives

icp_summary: K-12 school curriculum coordinators and instructional designers at public and private schools seeking to digitize textbook content into engaging video lessons.
market_diagnosis: Existing AI video platforms are priced for corporate training and lack educational formatting specificity
Manual conversion workflows are time-intensive and inconsistent in quality
Hybrid solutions only partially convert content, creating fragmented learning experiences
Current tools fail to handle textbook-specific structures and educational metadata at scale

must_have: Bulk textbook PDF upload and automated chapter/section parsing
AI-generated video lessons with synchronized textbook page scrolling
Customizable avatar instructors with voice selection options
LMS integration for Schoology, Canvas, and Google Classroom
explicitly_out_of_scope: Interactive quiz generation beyond basic comprehension checks
Custom animation studio for complex diagrams and simulations
Real-time collaboration features for multi-author textbooks
Advanced analytics dashboards beyond basic video engagement metrics

next_validation_step: Conduct structured interviews with 10 K-12 curriculum coordinators to validate pain points and pricing sensitivity around textbook conversion needs
notes: Synthesis based on validated ICP, current solution analysis, and identified unmet needs. MVP focused on core textbook conversion capabilities with educational specificity.
opportunity_gaps: Current tools optimize for corporate training over K-12 educational needs
Existing solutions lack textbook-specific parsing for educational frameworks
Market gap for affordable enterprise-scale textbook conversion
Need for standardized educational metadata integration
opportunity_statements: Users need cost-effective bulk conversion of entire textbooks while preserving educational formatting
Current solutions optimize for corporate training but fail at K-12 educational needs
Users need scalable district-wide implementation for textbook conversion
Users need reliable synchronization of complex textbook structures with video content
problem_statement: K-12 curriculum coordinators struggle to efficiently convert textbook explanations into engaging video lessons while maintaining educational integrity and managing costs.
unmet_needs: Cost-effective bulk conversion of entire textbooks
Reliable synchronization of complex textbook structures with video
Customizable avatar instructors matching curriculum personalities
workarounds: Using free tier AI tools for small-scale conversions
Sharing pre-converted video libraries among schools
Combining AI-generated scenes with manually created segments
Leveraging open-source transcription tools for audio-first approaches
